Bere
2019/KER/1019
IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
WEDNESDAY ,THE O9TH DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 19TH POUSHA, 1940
Cr1.MC.No. 140 of 2019
AGAINST THE ORDER IN CC 436/2017 of J.M.F.C., KAYAMKULAM
CRIME NO. 269/2007 OF Vallikunnam Police Station , Alappuzha
PETITIONERS :
1 NAUFAL,AGED 31 YEARS
S/O ABDHUL SALAM, NAUFAL MANSIL, THALAIRADIMURI,
VALLIKUNNAM VILLAGE.
2 HARRIS ,AGED 29 YEARS
S/O ABDUL KALAM, CHARIPPAN VILAYIL THALIRADY MURI,
VALLIKUNNAM.
BY ADVS.
SRI.R.SUNIL KUMAR
SMT.A.SALINI LAL
RESPONDENT:
SATE OF KERALA,
REP. BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA,
ERNAKULAM- 682031.
SRI.C.S HRITHWIK SR PP
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
09.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

2019/KER/1019
Cr1.MC.No. 140 of 2019 2
ORDER

Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. Petitioners were accused 1 and 4 in
C.C.No.189 of 2011 on the file of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court, Kayamkulam. The accused
allegedly committed the offences under Sections 143,
147, 148, 323, 324 and 326 r/w Section 149 IPC. As
the petitioners were absconding, only the others were
tried. They were acquitted by Annexure-II judgment.
The petitioners have surrendered and their case is
now pending as C.C.No.436 of 2017. The proceedings
are sought to be quashed in the light of the
acquittal of the co-accused.

3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners
and the learned Public Prosecutor.

4. I have perused Annexure-2 judgment by which
the co-accused were acquitted. T am satisfied that
the trial of the petitioners will not serve any

2019/KER/1019
Cr1.MC.No. 140 of 2019 3
purpose.

In the result, this Crl.M.C is allowed. The
proceedings in C.C.No.436 of 2017 on the file of the
Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kayamkulam are
quashed.

Sd/-
K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
JUDGE
